message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a decoder architecture for a low-density parity-check convolutional code (LDPC-CC) and discusses its error performance at different bit-energy-to-noise power-spectral-density ratios (Eb/N0). This falls under the scope of information theory.
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The proposed decoder architecture uses a dynamic message storage in the memory and a simple address controller. This involves designing efficient data structures and algorithms for memory management and addressing, which is a key aspect of data structures and algorithms.
3. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) - The paper discusses the implementation of the proposed decoder architecture on an Altera Stratix FPGA and achieves a high throughput of 2.0 Gb/s. This falls under the scope of hardware architecture.
4. cs.ET (Embedded Systems) - The implementation of the proposed decoder architecture on an FPGA involves designing an embedded system that can efficiently process LDPC-CCs. This falls under the scope of embedded systems.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The proposed decoder architecture involves designing a system that can efficiently decode LDPC-CCs and achieve a high throughput. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
